name: Brute force attack
description: A brute force attack, or exhaustive search is a password cracking approach where every combination of characters is tested until the correct one is found. This method is "guaranteed to work" given infinite time and resources which in a real-life scenario is not feasible.
details: Brute force attack involves trying every possible combination in a defined search space to find the correct value. The search space could be limited to just numbers, for example in the case of a 4-digit PIN number, or alphanumerical values or even the full ASCII character set. The larger the search space, the longer it takes to complete a brute force attack.
references: Kanta, A., Coray, S., Coisel, I. and Scanlon, M., 2021. How viable is password cracking in digital forensic investigation? Analyzing the guessability of over 3.9 billion real-world accounts. Forensic Science International: Digital Investigation, 37, p.301186.
